intro: Navarretia virgata var. oligantha, commonly known as the slender navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in open, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. It produces small, elongated seed pods that release tiny seeds when mature. Navarretia virgata var. oligantha is notable for its ability to thrive in arid conditions and its role in supporting local pollinator populations.
